movies.title: Impossible n'est pas Noël
movies.plot: In the tradition of such classic films as "Miracle On 34th Street", a hip, eccentric marketing genius teaches a widow and her son the miracle of Christmas.
movies.simplePlot: In the tradition of such classic films as "Miracle On 34th Street", a hip, eccentric marketing genius teaches a widow and her son the miracle of Christmas.

biography.bio: Gabrielle Carteris was born on January 2, 1961 in Scottsdale, Arizona, USA as Gabrielle Anne Carteris. She is an actress, known for Beverly Hills, 90210 (1990), Raising Cain (1992) and Impossible n'est pas Noël (2005). She has been married to Charles Isaacs since May 3, 1992. They have two children.
biography.name: Gabrielle Carteris

biography.bio: A leading man who is just as comfortable playing scary villains or comic sidekicks, Steve Bacic has gone from strength to strength culminating into a half-decade of non-stop work. Shortly after he moved from his home town of Windsor, Ontario to Vancouver, British Columbia, he landed a guest-starring role on the TV series 21 Jump Street (1987) -- the biggest part ever given a Canadian on the show at that time. Multiple episodes of Street Justice (1991), M.A.N.T.I.S. (1994), L'as de la crime (1991), Highlander (1992), Viper (1996) and The Marshal (1995) followed, along with important parts on Au-delà du réel - l'aventure continue (1995), The X-Files (1993), Millennium (1996), Andromeda (2000) and a recurring role on the short-lived but critically lauded Profit (1996). But it's in longer-form efforts such as She Stood Alone: The Tailhook Scandal (1995), Another Stakeout (1993) and Hardball (1997) (a.k.a. Bounty Hunters II) that Bacic has really been able to spread his wings. Admittedly an "instinct" player, he has been happy to learn the ropes from international stars like Gerald McRaney, Rosie O'Donnell and veteran Tony Curtis. Bacic regards one of his most unique professional experiences to-date as being the time he looked around the room while filming Another Stakeout (1993) and realized that he was alone with Rosie O'Donnell, Richard Dreyfuss, Emilio Estevez, the director (John Badham), the writer, and the producer.
biography.name: Steve Bacic

biography.bio: Jocelyne Loewen is an actress, known for Littlest Pet Shop (2012), Escaflowne (1996) and Chaos Theory (2008).
biography.name: Jocelyne Loewen

biography.bio: Pogue was an actor of movies and television. He is probably best known to many as Major Jonathan B. Clack in the late-night series Adderly. Mr. Pogue plays a broad range of characters over his long career. Is cast as a bad guy a lot of the time, but later was cast mostly as an aging spouse, parent, or grandparent of the films lead characters.
biography.name: Ken Pogue

biography.bio: Maureen Thomas is an actress and writer, known for Things We Lost in the Fire (2007), To Set Our House in Order (1985) and Impossible n'est pas Noël (2005).
biography.name: Maureen Thomas

biography.bio: Steven Culp was born on December 3, 1955 in La Jolla, California, USA as Steven Bradford Culp. He is an actor, known for One Life to Live (1968), Captain America: The Winter Soldier (2014) and James and the Giant Peach (1996). He has been married to Barbara Ayers since September 29, 1990. They have two children.
biography.name: Steven Culp

biography.bio: Josh Hayden was born on November 28, 1992 in British Columbia, Canada as Joshua Ryan Hayden. He is an actor, known for Impossible n'est pas Noël (2005), Christmas Caper (2007) and Fetching Cody (2005).
biography.name: Josh Hayden

biography.bio: Jonathan Hill is an actor, known for Tigerland (2000), Impossible n'est pas Noël (2005) and The Christmas Secret (2000).
biography.name: Jonathan Hill

biography.bio: Penny Blake is an actress, known for Snow White: The Fairest of Them All (2001), Once Upon a Christmas (2000) and Impossible n'est pas Noël (2005).
biography.name: Penny Blake

biography.bio: David Mylrea is known for his work on Destination finale (2000), X-Men: L'affrontement final (2006) and I, Robot (2004).
biography.name: David Mylrea

biography.bio: Rob Morton is an actor, known for The Neverending Story II: The Next Chapter (1990), 11 septembre - Le détournement du vol 93 (2006) and Who's Harry Crumb? (1989).
biography.name: Rob Morton

biography.bio: Aaron Pearl, (born May 11, 1972 in Sechelt, British Columbia, Canada) came to screen notice in 1996 with the romantic sports drama Annie O (1995). During that same year, Aaron found supporting roles in such TV-movies as Susie Q (1996), Home Song (1996) and Le Titanic (1996). Contrasting his strong television credentials, Aaron's work also includes appearances within such better-known films as X-Men 2 (2003), X-Men: L'affrontement final (2006), King Rising - Au nom du Roi (2007), Man of Steel (2013). In 1999 he wrote, directed, and executive produced his first film Little Boy Blues (1999).
biography.name: Aaron Pearl

biography.bio: John Hombach is known for his work on Dreamcatcher (2003), Impossible n'est pas Noël (2005) and Secret conjugal (2005).
biography.name: John Hombach

biography.bio: Justin Callan is an actor, known for X-Men: L'affrontement final (2006), The Core (2003) and Scary Movie 4 (2006).
biography.name: Justin Callan

biography.bio: Michelle BOBACK has been nominated for two ACTRA Awards for her lead performance in the film 'Day Before Yesterday' with director Patricia Chica, and as Dr. Megan Reed in the video game Deus Ex- Human Revolution and Mankind Divided. Her connection to video games doesn't end there, as she worked with Guenter Schulz and En Esch (of KMFDM-fame, Mortal Kombat soundtrack) on three of their solo albums as Slick Idiot. Her Sophomore album 'Release' with producer Beatchild (Drake, Divine Brown...release date Dec. 2016) Boback who plays Dr. Reed in the Deus Ex series is actually married to Adam Jensen, actor Elias Toufexis.
biography.name: Michelle Boback

categories.category: Best Performance in a TV Movie, Miniseries or Special - Supporting Young Actor
